business.facades

Class OrderFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • business.facades.OrderFacade

  • public class OrderFacade
extends Object
    Order Facade transitions datamapper methods to Facade methods so Servlets do not have direct contact with the database. Following the 3 layer architecture design rules. OrderServlet makes objects out of this class

      • createOrder

        public static void createOrder(int customerId,
                               int salesRepId,
                               Timestamp date,
                               String carportType,
                               String roofType,
                               int carportWidth,
                               int carportLength,
                               int shedWidth,
                               int shedLength,
                               Double angle,
                               Boolean status,
                               double price)
                        throws StorageLayerException
        * This is an ''instance'' of createOrder method from OrderMapper
        Parameters:
        customerId - id of the customer
        salesRepId - id of the employee
        date - date of the order creation
        carportType - type of the carport(pointy or flat)
        roofType - type of the roof
        carportWidth - width of the carport
        carportLength - length of the carport
        shedWidth - width of the shed
        shedLength - length of the shed
        angle - angle of the roof
        status - is the order paid or not
        price - the ammount that is needed to pay
        Throws:
        StorageLayerException
